title: The Oxford handbook of health care management
subject: Services de santé -- Administration
Politique sanitaire
Health and Fitness
Medical policy
Health services administration
Health and Wellbeing
description: This Handbook provides an authoritative overview of current issues and debates in the field of health care management. It contains over twenty chapters from well-known and eminent academic authors, who were carefully selected for their expertise and asked to provide a broad and critical overview of developments in their particular topic area. The development of an international perspective and body of knowledge is a key feature of the book. The Handbook secondly makes a case for bringing back a social science perspective into the study of the field of health care management. It therefore contains a number of contrasting and theoretically orientated chapters (e.g. on institutionalism; critical management studies). This social science based approach is a refreshing alternative to much existing work in this domain and offers a good way into current academic debates in this field. The Handbook thirdly explores a variety of important policy and organizational developments apparent within the current health care field (e.g. new organizational forms; growth of management consulting in health care organizations). It therefore explores and comments on major contemporary trends apparent in the practice field.
contributor: Reff Pedersen, Anne, 1970- editor.$$QReff Pedersen, Anne
contents: Institutionalization and professionalization / Trish Reay, Elizabeth Goodrick, Bob Hinings -- Narratives of Health Policy / Graeme Currie, Graham Martin -- A New Lens on Organizational Innovations in Health Care / Stephen Shortell, Rachael Addicott -- Culture in Health Care Organizations / Russell Mannion, Huw Davies -- The Critical Health Care Management Domain / Martin Kitchener, Richard Thomas -- Interprofessional Interactions and their Impact on Professional Boundaries / Louise Fitzgerald -- Effective Team Working in Health Care / Michael A. West, Lynn Markiewicz -- Re-humanizing Health Care / Cheryl Rathert, Timothy J. Vogus, Laura McClelland -- A Discursive Approach to Organizational Health Communication / Peter Kjær, Anne Reff Pedersen, Anja Svejgaard Pors -- Health Care Transparency in Organizational Perspective / Charlotta Levay -- Clinical Ethics Support in Contemporary Health Care / Evan Doran, Ian Kerridge, Christopher Jordens, Ainsley J. Newson -- Plural Leadership in Health Care Organizations / Viviane Sergi, Mariline Comeau-Vallée, Maria Lusiani, Jean-Louis Denis, Ann Langley -- Patient Safety and Quality / Jeffrey Braithwaite, Liam Donaldson -- Mobilizing Knowledge in Health Care / Huw Davies, Alison Powell, Sandra Nutley -- The Paradox of Health Care Performance Measurement and Management / Jenny M. Lewis -- Implementing E-Health / Bill Doolin -- Communities of Practice and Situated Learning in Health Care / Davide Nicolini, Harry Scarbrough, Julia Gracheva -- Accountability in Health Care / Haldor Byrkeflot, Karsten Vrangbaek -- Pharmaceuticals, Money, and the Health Care Organizational Field / Wendy Lipworth -- Management Consulting in Health / Ian Kirkpatrick, Chris Lonsdale, Indraneth Neogy -- Re-placing Care / Roland Bal, Lieke Oldenhof, Jeroen Postma.
relation: $$Cform$$VPrint version: Oxford handbook of health care management. First edition. Oxford, United Kingdom : Oxford University Press, 2016$$QOxford handbook of health care management.$$Z990042810760107871
